Description: Rock crystal bottle; carved in the form of a recumbent stylised lion with its rump truncated to form a flat base for the bottle to stand upright; polished.
Curator's comments: The posture of the lion was possibly determined by the grain of the quartz.
Bibliographic references: Pinder-Wilson 1954 / Some Rock Crystals of the Islamic Period (pl.xxxiv.a)
Lamm 1929-1930 / Mittelalterliche Gläser und Steinschnittarbeiten aus dem Nahen Osten (pl.75.17)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 19 Mar-2 Jun, Qatar, Doha, Museum of Islamic Art, 'Gifts of the Sultans' 2011-2012 23 Oct-15 Jan, USA, Houston, Museum of Fine Arts, 'Gifts of the Sultans' 2011 05 Jun-30 Sept, USA, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County Museum of Art, 'Gifts of the Sultans'
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
